title: NRL Round 22 – Melbourne Storm v Illawarra Dragons
articleContent:
NRL is back at AAMI Park. This matchup is sure to deliver edge-of-your-seat action. Public transport is your best way to enjoy it, as the Melbourne Storm takes on the Illawarra Dragons. Extra services will help you get to and from AAMI Park on Saturday 3 August.

The event will begin at 5:30pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

Metropolitan train

Return service from Richmond Station:

  • Ringwood – leaving at 7:40pm and 7:57pm from Platform 9
  • Glen Waverley – leaving at 7:49pm from Platform 10
  • East Pakenham - leaving at 7:54pm from Platform 6
  • Frankston - leaving at 7:49pm from Platform 4
  • Sandringham – leaving at 7:54pm from Platform 2

Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Route 70

  • Trams will operate from Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

Metropolitan bus

Customers can catch the following buses close to the MCG:

  • Route 246 

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

Regional train

  • Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station
